00058 /** Debug levels for driver prints. */
00059 #define DBG_ALL       7
00060 #define DBG_STRUCT    6
00061 #define DBG_NORM      4
00062 #define DBG_FLOW      3
00063 #define DBG_WARN      2
00064 #define DBG_ERROR     1
00065 #define DBG_CRIT      0
00066 
00067 #define DBG_TEMP      0

00075 #define  castptr(type, val)    ((type)((unsigned long)val))

00079 /** Print debug messages.
00080  *
00081  *  @param lvl    - debug level at which to print this message.
00082  *  @param format - format to use to print the message.
00083  *  @param args   - variable length arg list to create the message.
00084  */
00085 #ifdef OCTEON_DEBUG_LEVEL
00086 #define DBG_PRINT(lvl, format, args...) \
00087 { \
00088     if (lvl <= OCTEON_DEBUG_LEVEL) \
00089     { \
00090         printf("[ DRV ]"); \
00091         printf(format, ##args); \
00092     } \
00093 }
00094 #else
00095 #define DBG_PRINT(lvl, format, args...)  do{ }while(0)
00096 #endif
00097 
00098 
00099 #define drv_err(format, args...)    printf(format, ##args)
00100 
00101 //#define dbg_printf(format, ...)    printf( format, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00102 
00103 #define dbg_printf(format, ...)    do { } while(0)

00106 #ifndef ROUNDUP4
00107 #define ROUNDUP4(val) (((val) + 3)&0xfffffffc)
00108 #endif
00109 
00110 #ifndef ROUNDUP8
00111 #define ROUNDUP8(val) (((val) + 7)&0xfffffff8)
00112 #endif
00113 
00114 #ifndef ROUNDUP16
00115 #define ROUNDUP16(val) (((val) + 15)&0xfffffff0)
00116 #endif

00119 /**
00120  getstructptr - get the address of structure given the address of a member
00121   Params:
00122         ptr: the pointer to the member.
00123        type: the type of the struct this ptr is a member.
00124      member: the name of the member within the struct.
00125 */
00126 #define getstructptr(ptr, type, member)                   \
00127      (type *)( (char *)ptr - offsetof(type,member) )
00128

00131 #define   CVM_DRV_GET_PHYS(ptr)         (cast64(cvmx_ptr_to_phys(ptr)))
00132 #define   CVM_DRV_GET_PTR(phys_addr)    cvmx_phys_to_ptr((phys_addr))

00144 #ifdef  CVM_SPINLOCK_DEBUG
00145 
00146 static inline void
00147 cvm_drv_spinlock_trylockloop(cvmx_spinlock_t  *lockp)
00148 {
00149    volatile uint32_t lock_loops=0;
00150    while(cvmx_spinlock_locked(lockp) && (lock_loops++ < 1000));
00151    if(lock_loops == 1000)
00152       printf("[ DRV ] Spinlock @ %p failed at %s: %d \n",lockp, __FILE__, __LINE__);
00153    cvmx_spinlock_lock(lockp);
00154 }
00155 
00156 #define  cvm_drv_spinlock_lock(lockp)                 cvm_drv_spinlock_trylockloop(lockp);
00157 
00158 #else
00159 
00160 #define  cvm_drv_spinlock_lock(lockp)                 cvmx_spinlock_lock(lockp);
00161 
00162 #endif

00169 #define cvm_drv_fpa_alloc_sync(pool)                 \
00170         cvm_common_alloc_fpa_buffer_sync((pool))
00171 
00172 #define cvm_drv_fpa_free(ptr, pool, cache_lines)     \
00173         cvm_common_free_fpa_buffer((ptr), (pool), (cache_lines))

00179 static inline void
00180 cvm_drv_free_pkt_buffer(cvmx_buf_ptr_t  pkt)
00181 {
00182     void  *buf;
00183 
00184     buf = (void *)CVM_DRV_GET_PTR((((uint64_t)pkt.s.addr >> 7) - pkt.s.back) << 7);
00185     DBG_PRINT(DBG_FLOW,"Freeing pkt buf @ %p (pkt: 0x%016lx)\n", buf, pkt.u64);
00186     cvm_drv_fpa_free(buf, pkt.s.pool, 0);
00187 }

00191 
00192 
00193 /** Core: Call this routine to free the packet buffers in a work queue entry (WQE).
00194   * The packet pointer is made NULL and buf count is 0 in the WQE when this routine
00195   * returns.
00196   * @param wqe - the wqe whose buffers are to be freed.
00197   */
00198 static inline void
00199 cvm_free_wqe_packet_bufs(cvmx_wqe_t  *wqe)
00200 {
00201 #ifdef SANITY_CHECKS
00202     if(wqe->word2.s.bufs) {
00203         cvm_common_linked_buffer_sanity_and_count_update(wqe->packet_ptr,
00204                                        wqe->word2.s.bufs, 0);
00205     }
00206 #endif
00207     cvmx_helper_free_packet_data(wqe);
00208 
00209     wqe->word2.s.bufs = 0;
00210     wqe->packet_ptr.u64 = 0;
00211     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00212 }
00213 
00214 
00215 
00216 
00217 
00218 /** Core: Free a work queue entry (WQE) and its buffers received from the
00219  *  hardware. 
00220  *  @param  wqe - work queue entry buffer to be freed.
00221  *  Frees a work queue entry and its packet data buffer.
00222  */
00223 static inline void
00224 cvm_free_host_instr(cvmx_wqe_t    *wqe)
00225 {
00226    if(wqe == NULL) {
00227       printf("[ DRV ]: cvm_free_host_instr: NULL WQE\n");
00228       return;
00229    }
00230    DBG_PRINT(DBG_FLOW,"--free_host_instr, wqe @ %p, pkt @ %llx-\n",
00231              wqe, cast64(wqe->packet_ptr.s.addr));
00232    cvm_free_wqe_packet_bufs(wqe);
00233    DBG_PRINT(DBG_FLOW,"Freeing wqe @ 0x%p \n",wqe);
00234    cvm_drv_fpa_free(wqe, CVMX_FPA_WQE_POOL, 0);
00235 }
00236 
00237 
00238 #define  cvm_free_wqe_and_pkt_bufs(wqe) cvm_free_host_instr((wqe))
00239 
00240 
00241 
00242 
00243 /** Core: Common Asynchronous allocation routine for all core driver components.
00244   * @param scratch_pad: scratch pad location where address of new buffer
00245   *                     will be written by hardware.
00246   * @param pool       : The pool from which async allocation is done.
00247   * @return If allocation was successful, return ptr to buffer, else NULL.
00248   */
00249 static inline  void  *
00250 cvm_drv_fpa_alloc_async(uint64_t  scratch_pad, uint64_t  pool)
00251 {
00252    void  *buf = NULL;
00253    buf = cvm_common_alloc_fpa_buffer(scratch_pad, pool);
00254    DBG_PRINT(DBG_FLOW,"buffer allocated at 0x%p\n",buf);
00255    return buf;
00256 }

00259 typedef union {
00260     uint64_t   u64;
00261     struct {
00262 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00263        uint64_t   tag:32;        /**< 31-00 Tag for the Packet. */
00264        cvmx_pow_tag_type_t tt:2; /**< 33-32 Tagtype */
00265        uint64_t   rs:1;          /**< 34    Is the PCI packet a RAW-SHORT? */
00266        uint64_t   grp:4;         /**< 38-35 The group that gets this Packet */
00267        uint64_t   qos: 3;        /**< 41-39 The QOS set for this Packet. */
00268        uint64_t   fsz:6;
00269        uint64_t   dlengsz:14;
00270        uint64_t   gather:1;
00271        uint64_t   r:1;           /**< 63    Is the PCI packet in RAW-mode? */
00272 #else
00273        uint64_t   r:1;           /**< 63    Is the PCI packet in RAW-mode? */
00274        uint64_t   gather:1;
00275        uint64_t   dlengsz:14;
00276        uint64_t   fsz:6;
00277        uint64_t   qos: 3;        /**< 41-39 The QOS set for this Packet. */
00278        uint64_t   grp:4;         /**< 38-35 The group that gets this Packet */
00279        uint64_t   rs:1;          /**< 34    Is the PCI packet a RAW-SHORT? */
00280        cvmx_pow_tag_type_t tt:2; /**< 33-32 Tagtype */
00281        uint64_t   tag:32;        /**< 31-00 Tag for the Packet. */
00282 #endif
00283     } s;
00284 } cvm_pci_host_inst_hdr_t;
